number of helpful: 324 of 413 people (78%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
3, 2016
												I want to say out of the gate that a I think it is very unjustified and unfair to give this game negative reviews for not being a Trials Fusion clone, additionally, these complaints are coming from people with less that 30 minutes in game. Trials of the Blood Dragon like Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon was never intended to be a successor or continuation of the parent game. If you were expecting that you should look elsewhere because you will likely be disappointed. Aside from similar gameplay mechanics Trials of the blood Dragon like Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon was supposed to be a fun departure from the main game and I believe that is exactly what they have done.I went into this game expecting what I got from Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon, which was an absolutely ridiculous, over the top, stylized, comedic parody of 80s video games and action films, and that is exactly what I got. The game features anther excellent soundtrack from Power Glove which really compliments the exaggerated 80s style of the game. In addition to the new look Trials of the Blood Dragon adds new gameplay mechanics such as shooting from your bike and on foot segments. For some people these new additions may be a hit or a miss since it is a departure from what fans of previous trials games have come to expect. The bottom line is that if you go into this game expecting a Trials reskin you are going to be disappointed, for the price you get a lot of content and style for what you are paying for. Fans of Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon and its over the top 80s look should feel right at home with Trials of the Blood Dragon.Pros:Fantastic styleInteresting additions to gameplayGreat amount of content for the priceAnother amazing soundtrack from Power GloveCons: Some new additions such as on foot segments can be tedious(Subjective) A significant departure from past trials gameplay

number of helpful: 13 of 19 people (68%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
0, 2016
												PROS:- A lot of variety in gameplay- Interesting level designs and changes- Story has its funny moments- Great Set PiecesCONS:- Short as all hell- Pretty easy compared to other Trails games- Voice acting is BAAAAAADI was kind of surprised to see this pop up on steam, I honestly thought it was one of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥ rip-offs that slide in through greenlight. Turns out this is all legit and once you actually start playing the game that becomes pretty obvious. The production values for the levels are way ahead of any of the previous Trials games. With most of them featuring at least one flashy set piece.Of course the downside of that is that you end up paying more attention to the background and crash a hell of alot. In fact one of the biggest problems with the game is the fact that it mixes so many playstyles in together. In a single level you can go from driving a Tank to a motor bike to a Jetpack. Which is cool but does mean that you are not likely to get anything approaching a good time the first time through a lot of levels as you wrestle with the widely different handling of each mode. One of the other downsides to the more polished and flashy levels is the length of the game. Even with a bunch of deaths I still beat the game in about two hours. Obviously I will go back and try to ace the levels which should double the time but compared to the length of Trials Fusion this is depressingly short. Along with that the game never reaches the challenge of Fusion. You never really have to be that precise with your controls and it's only in the last level that you start to face more advanced challenges.Having said all of that there is still a bunch of stuff I have yet to do in the game outside of the story missions. There are five secret keys to find each with a clue to where it is along with rewards for acing levels. For £11.99GBP I think it is a tight little package. If you go in expecting something on the scale of Fusion then you are going to be disappointed but by the same token there are no levels in dull static warehouses to grind through. I like Fusion but it was pretty padded in some areas and this game doesn’t do that. Choosing to cut out all of the fat to give you pure spectacle.

												If you're expecting a Trials Fusion clone then don't buy this game.Whilst the bike riding aspect is the exact same, this game is completely different. It's a completely fresh Trials experience. Combines platforming at some points, then goes to riding a bike whilst shooting a gun. I personally think the price is a bit too high. Within my 3.3 hours current gametime I've completed the main story as well as the extra tracks from the ubisoft rewards points and the secret ones. (Which involves finding secrets in game) £12 is reasonable, But the length feels like it wasn't worth that exact amount. If the game goes on sale eventually for a bit cheaper I would definitely recommend you pick it up. The game itself was extremely fun with an interactive storyline, good voice acting and funny cutscenes. It's a heavily story driven game with great encounters and an all round great game. Just as I said, it's not a Trials clone. So don't be disappointed if you buy it expecting that.

content:
8, 2016
												This game should be judged as a Standalone DLC to Trials Fusion.Gameplay wise it is basically a collection of Skill Games from Trials Fusion, with a couple of normal "bike" tracks.First playthrough of the game for most people would probably be about 3-4 hours.This game, as with all other trials, has leaderboards, and that is where the replay value comes in if you are a competitive person. Look to my "total time played" to see how much value I personally have gotten out of the game.Keep in mind that because this should be considered a standalone DLC, There is no multiplayer or user created tracks. That part of the game is still on Trials Fusion. This was done on purpose as stated by developers in order to not uneccessarily split the community across 2 different Track Centrals. So if you want multiplayer or custom maps, then you should buy and play trials fusion. If you want a collection of skill games with a storyline, then buy this.Just to make my point as clear as possible. For any of you that played Halo 3 and Halo 3:  ODST. This game is Halo 3: ODST. AKA, New campaign, but if you want to play multiplayer, you are still playing Halo 3 (Trials Fusion).

												If you were looking for a new Trials game this is not for you. This game puts the worst aspects of the game's physics engine on display through wonky platforming, shooting, grappling, and jetpacking levels to name a few. Theres very few actual trials levels in this game that do not have any of these awful levels shoehorned into them. Not to mention the game doesn't have even a quarter of the content that Trials Fusion had. There's no track central, no challenges, no skill games, no fmx, no multiplayer, and fewer overall levels. As someone who loves the trials franchise this game is a huge disappointment. I imagine fans of Far Cry Blood Dragon would feel the same. A game that somehow manages to ruin 2 franchises.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
28
												Trials of the Blood Dragon has a lot in common with its infamous E3 presentation; a great, bold, different idea on paper that turned out terrible in execution.I came into this game expecting very polished level design as seen in the previous Trials games. Trials HD and Trials Evolution both had a great difficulty curve, tons of customization, and different bikes for you to choose from. This game offers none of that. You are set in a 27 mission single player experience. No different bikes. No customization. No user created content. No multiplayer. For the same price point as Trials Evolution, this game is an absolute joke when it comes to content. I was able to complete the *entirety* of the game in under 2 hours.Plot: The idea of an actual intertwined story that links the missions together, rather than levels being discrete and separated from one another is a great idea. I don't know if I really needed a story within a Trials campaign, but the idea is great. However the execution on this story was awful. The plot is neither funny nor interesting like that of Far Cry: Blood Dragon. The two main characters have very stilted dialogue and poor voice acting.Mechanics: There are three new mechanics added to this game over previous entries in the Trials series. Enemies and weapons, a grappling hook, and... on foot platforming.The ability to use an smg on your bike is by far the best mechanic added. In order to complete races as quickly as possible, the smg allows you clear a path by shooting enemies, or by shooting switches in order to open doors. This provides a more flexible level design, and seems like a very smooth addition. The grappling hook functions in the same way as the gun, but you use it to reach certain vertical areas. I feel like this addition to the game was not as well executed as the machine gun's, as it removes any and all challenging platforming sections that were available in previous games.Finally... on foot sections. God... What do I even say. This was an absolute mistake to add to the game. Clunky, slow, repetitive platforming that is not satisfying and NOT what I would want out of either a Trials game or a Far Cry game. One weapon. One enemy type. Not enjoyable in the slightest.Final Verdict:In theory, a cross between Far Cry Blood Dragon and the Trials series sounds like a wonderous time. Gun toting, action packed biking. Instead, we get an incredibly short, repetitive, unchallenging, and not too fun game that's mediocre at best.

												TL;DR: Buy if you're a big fan of Trials, wait for a sale if you're not. 7.5/10. It's really fun and has some decent replay value. Eff the haters who only have 20-30 minutes on record giving negative reviews.If you honestly believe the negative reviews of this game then you should think about who you trust. People down here dissing this game for saying it's so short and easy and they only have 20-30 minutes on record. This just shows you that they haven't even started to play this game. I am an expert trials player and i just finished the game at the 3.7 hour mark. I got 100% gold or platinum on every track in trials fusion in under 2 hours. This is a really cool game and refreshing to say the least. It is certainly not a standard trials game. I was hoping for some time trial maps and expert difficulty tracks. Since this game doesn't have that it doesn't take away from it. This game wasn't meant for that. Instead of me instantly coming to write a negative review, I looked down and noticed that i wasn't a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ bag so I decided to review the game for what it is. It is a VERY fun 3-4 hour game with moderate replay value down the road. If you don't like trials you should wait for a sale but if you like trials or fun, silly games pick this badboy up. In all seriousness as a trials fan I'd give this a solid 7.5/10. I'm not IGN so 7.5 doesn't mean its the worst game of all time. It's really cool. Pick it up!

content:
5, 2016
												Trials of the Blood Dragon is a nice departure from the Trials series. If you are lookig for a normal Trials game, then this title is not for you. However, if you are open to changes, then I highly recommend this game. There are a few tedious sections here and there, but you will be able to get over it and enjoy the game for what it is.Like the normal series, the Trials sections get more and more difficult throughout the progression of the game. Sadly, I felt as though it was not super challenging until the very last mission. So I blew through all of the Trials missions with ease, but I still had fun because it's just like Trials! Every other mission was either 'okay' or 'good', nothing bad to come from this game, really.I have never played Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon (FPS isn't really my cup of tea unless I'm playing multiplayer with friends), but I thought that I should probably give that a look after playing this game. The aesthetics are super nice and the music is VERY good.If I had one complaint, it's that this game is way too short. I beat this in only two and a half hours and there's no real replay ability in it. It would just be the same missions over and over again. I thought that this game would be a lot better with a level editor or something to go with it so that people can create and share their own missions. That would make me want to play this game more and more.In conclusion, this game is really fun. It has a fantastic soundtrack and a pretty vaporwave art style. I do not recommend getting this game for $15. If this game goes for sale for around $5 then you should definitely pick it up. It's short and full of adventure!

Beware for a short game it costs 15 dollars, you get very little content.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
7, 2016
												Why did Red Lynx waste so much time on this when they could have been working on a sequel to Fusion? This is not a Trials game foremost, but most of all, it's not a good game period. It bases its spirit on Trials but loses the entire point and becomes a jack of all trades for a hodgepodge of different game types haphazardly assembled together. Do you like absolutely awful, floaty side scrolling shooters with the worst enemy A.I. you've ever seen? Do you like pointless distracting additions to trials tracks like shooting targets instead of focusing on time and technique? Do you like weird RC car segments with frustrating controls that reverse on you? Do you like excessively intrusive story sequences in the style of esurance commercials and cheesy throwbacks to absurd 70's action movies? Well Blood Dragon wants to do all sorts of things, none of them any good and all cobbled together so you can't separate the ones you don't want to play. It's just not a good game and we could have been that much closer to a proper Trials sequel if they didn't get on this weird DLC bandwagon for introducing ridiculous internet humor inspired remixes like riding a unicorn. They lost focus on the core of Trials, hopefully they turn it around.

												If you like Trials then you might like this game, but if you just liked the first Blood Dragon then avoid it. The game is totally different and seems like a cash in on the Blood Dragon name. It's the same price as the first one but has probably less than half the play time. And that includes going back to get better grades in the stages, which I have no idea why anyone would want to do. The whole point of the game is just to get from point A to point B, but do it with terrible controls and unrealistic physics. Pick it up if it's on sale for $5 but I wouldn't suggest paying any more than that for it.

												I don't even know what to say. What the hell even is this game? Because it sure isn't the Trials games I loved in the past. Wait until the youtube videos go up, watch a few. Then decide if you want to buy this game. Only game I've ever refunded on steam. It feels like the heart and soul of Trials games has taken a backseat to the gimmicks and flat out stupid additions to the game. Things like a story that doesn't add anything to the game, small "comic" like cutscenes that are interspersed in each levels. There is even a mode where you get off your bike and the game becomes a platformer with twin stick shooter elements. I just don't understand what Red Lynx was thinking when they made this game. They strayed so far from the gameplay mechanics and design that made Trials HD and Trials EVO what they were.In short, save your money now. Wait for youtube videos to get a feel for the game, then make a decision to buy. I recommend going and picking up a previous title, something like Trials Evolution.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
ry 19
												What happens when you mix Blood Dragon with a Trials game? Something awesome!First of all, yes, the off bike sections are clunky, 2D platforming obviously isn't RedLynx's specialty. But that's fine! The best part of the game is the whacky disjointed story told through fantastic animated cutscenes and in level dialogue. If you played Far Cry Blood Dragon you should have a good idea of the tone of this game, however while that was more a parody of R rated action movies this one is more PG 13, even comedically censoring itself at times.The on bike / mine cart / truck sections are quite entertaining, there's some mindfreak sections, there's cool environments to go through, and there's insectoid aliens to murderize. But you never know when you'll switch mode of transportation mid level and I really have no interest in trying to set good scores on platforming that's primarily difficult because the controls are bad (eg. landing one foot on a platform means you bounce off and potentially fall to your death). But again, I still think it's worth at least running through once for the story, it's so delightful and I guarantee it will make you smile.
